questions.question: 1. The greatest common divisor of 84, 90, and 66 (that is, the largest exact divisor of all three numbers) is:

20. "Snake-eyes" occur when you roll two 1's on a pair of  regular, 6-sided dice numbered from 1 to 6. On  any  roll, what is the  probability of rolling  snake-eyes?

27. At a certain store, all radios are discounted to 15% less than the radio's regular price. A customer brings a radio marked with regular price of $120 to the a checkout counter. If a sales tax of 5% of the purchase price is added (rounded to the nearest cent), how much money does the customer owe?

28. Distances marked on the figure below are in feet. Points B, E, F, and C are collinear as are points A, H, G, and D. If the area of rectangle ABCD is 33 square feet and EH and FG are each perpendicular to AD, what is the area, in square feet, of trapezoid AEFD?

31. On Family Day, attendance at the baseball game set a record. A reporter for the local paper asked how many adults had paid to see the game. The box office reported that exactly 450 tickets had been sold, and $2,000 was collected. If adults' tickets were $5 and children's tickets were $3, how many adults' tickets were sold?

36.  Three-ring notebooks are made in 2 steps: Machine A makes 180 covers per hour. Later, Machine B attaches the 3-ring paper holder and completes 150 notebooks per hour. How many hours should Machine A run in order to produce the right number of covers for Machine B to finish in exactly8 hours of its operation?

42. Three times a year a camera shop has a sale on packages of batteries: in February packages are 3 for $4.49, in April they are 5 for $7.39, and in December they are 4 for $5.88. In which ordered sequence of months does the price per package go from smallest to middle to largest?
43. The trinomial x2 - x - 6 can be factored as the product of 2 linear factors, in the form (x + a)(x + b). What is the polynomial sum of these 2 factors?
44. A rectangular field is twice as long as it is wide, and has an area of 288 square meters. How many meters long is it?

48. From a point on the ground the angle of elevation to a ledge on a building is 27°, and the distance to the base of the building is 45 meters. How many meters high is the ledge?
49. In the standard(x, y) coordinate plane there is only one circle centered at the point (-1, 4) that also passes through the point (7, -2) Which of the following is an equation for that circle?
50. If a is any real number, for what real value(s) of b does the equation |x + a| = b have NO solutions for x?

53. To work properly, an engine part's diameter cannot be over the specified diameter of 3 centimeters by more than .05 centimeters, nor can it be under the specified diameter by more than .05 centimeters. If x is the diameter of a part, which of the following algebraic statements specifies these restrictions on x?
54. For all a ≠ 0; what is the slope of the line segment connecting (a, b) and (-a, b) in the usua| (x, y) coordinate plane?

55. Starting at her doorstep, Ramona walked down the sidewalk at 1.5 feet per second for 4 seconds. Then she stopped for 4 seconds, realizing that she had forgotten something. Next she returned to her doorstep along the same route at 1.5 feet per second. The graph of Ramona's distance (d) from her doorstep as a function of time (t) would most resemble which of the following ?
56. For the quadratic equation 2x2 + 5x + R = 0, what value of R will make the solutions for x be  and -3 ?

59. If f(x) = 3x3 - 27x, which of the following correctly describes the zeros of the polynomial ?(Note: Zeros are values of x where f(x) = 0)

choices.C: Only 1 real zero, which is irrational

questions.question: 60. Given 9 points, NO 3 of which lie on the same straight line, what is the maximum number of straight lines that can be drawn through pairs of those 9 points ?
